Working with the Audit List

When you click the Audit tab, it displays audit log entries for the selected view in the upper pane of the project view window. The Audit menu item also becomes available on the menu bar.

All entries shown in the Audit list:

  • Are associated with the folder selected from the StarTeam folder hierarchy.

  • Match the filter selected from the Filter drop-down list box.

  • Match the depth specified by the All Descendants button.

Using the Audit List

Audit log entries cannot be moved, shared, modified, or branched. However, a few operations can be performed on these items.

Search for items

You can select Audit > Find, Audit > Find Next, or Audit > Find Previous to locate items on the Audit list that have a specified value in a column.

Send items via e-mail

You can click Audit > Send to send items (except for attached files) on the Audit list as e-mail.

Report and chart items

You can select Audit > Reports or Audit > Charts to create reports and charts for items on the Audit list.

Filter data

In the Audit list, you can rearrange audit fields, show different fields, use group bands, and apply queries to the data in the audit log. You can also save the operations you have performed on the data as a query or filter.

Sort columns

You can click an audit column header to perform a sort based on the value in that column. The sort is usually in ascending numeric or alphanumeric order, depending on the data. To change the sort order from ascending to descending (or vice versa), click the header a second time. A triangle indicating the direction of the sort appears on the header of the primary sort column.

The columns usually displayed for each audit entry are:

  • User: Person performing the action.

  • Created Time: Date and time of the action.

  • Class Name: Type of object, such as file, folder, change request, or topic

  • Event: Name of the action, such as Created, Added, Deleted, Modified, Branched, Moved From, Shared, Locked, Unlocked, Moved to, or Lock broken.

  • View: Name of the view in which the object is located.

  • Project: Name of project where the object is located.

Refresh view

Press Shift + F5 to refresh the entire view (all item lists in all tabs as well as the StarTeam folder hierarchy). Press F5 to refresh only the Audit list. Press Ctrl + F5 to refresh the list and collapse all open groups simultaneously.
